sub_title: Senior Programme Advisor LAND-at-scale at Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO.nl)
summary: Motivated and result oriented land governance specialist with over ten years of work experience in - amongst others - the Netherlands, Egypt, Indonesia, Italy, Kenya, Mozambique, Palestinian Territories, Tanzania and Uganda. Skilled in developing and managing projects and programmes; initiating and boosting partnerships; designing and conducting research; communicating and publishing; developing and implementing multi-stakeholder platforms, workshops and learning trajectories.

publications.name: Linking Land Governance and Food Security in Africa - Reflection paper

profile_positions.description: Programme Advisor for LAND-at-scale, a global land governance support programme of the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs, managed by RVO. Involved in programme-wide activities, including knowledge management, monitoring & evaluation, and communication; positioning of the programme, and networking in the broader land governance community. Responsible for LAND-at-scale country projects in Egypt, Mozambique, Palestinian Territories, and Somalia.
profile_positions.title: Programme Advisor LAND-at-scale

profile_positions.description:
As multi-stakeholder facilitator for the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs, I am responsible for the LANDdialogue. The LANDdialogue is a platform of stakeholders from Dutch private sector, government, knowledge institutes and NGO's who have expressed their willingness and ambition to contribute to the improvement of land governance in countries where they are active. This has resulted in the Dutch LANDdialogue; it is the explicit goal of the participants to promote the practical application and monitoring of improvement measures by the Dutch private sector, government, knowledge institutes and NGOs in line with the United Nations Voluntary Guidelines on Land Tenure (VGGTs). Learning about, and the development and application of concrete solutions that lead to better land governance in policies and practice are central in this multi-stakeholder process. Activities are designed and facilitated by the Organising Committee which is comprised of representatives from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, LANDac, Oxfam Novib, Utrecht University, Netherlands Development Bank FMO, Rabobank, IDH Sustainable Trade Initiative and Both ENDS. 

As multi-stakeholder facilitator I work closely with members of the Organising Committee, and I am responsible for its general progress; organising multi-stakeholder workshops, consultation sessions, and expert meetings on specific land governance issues; providing follow-up on studies related to land governance and international Corporate Social Responsibility; coordinating in-depth follow-up studies of land governance issues in specific economic sectors; and designing and organising the LANDdialogue's annual High Level meeting with the Minister for Foreign Trade and Development Cooperation.
profile_positions.title: Multi-stakeholder Facilitator

company.name: CIFOR - Center for International Forestry Research

profile_positions.company: CIFOR - Center for International Forestry Research
profile_positions.description:
As project lead Learning Platforms on Inclusive Business, Land Governance and Food Security for CIFOR, I was responsible for designing, networking, lobbying, and implementing multi-stakeholder learning platforms on responsible investments in Tanzania, Mozambique and Uganda. 

The Learning Platforms were set up in investment hubs in Tanzania, Mozambique and Uganda, and aim to better link local knowledge and context with multi-stakeholder learning and dialogue, accompanied by follow-up activities for implementation and monitoring. The main aim of the platforms is to optimise local impacts of agro-food investments for food security in the three target countries, and within the implementation of the platforms, the main activities related to conducting research and facilitating multi-stakeholder exchange. For each of the platforms I recruited international companies in agriculture and forestry, all of which were involved in the platforms as well as follow-up activities. 

I was furthermore responsible for contract management and budgeting; as well as the coordination between the involved learning platform partner organisations, namely CIFOR, Shared Value Foundation, the Netherlands Land Academy (LANDac) and the Food & Business Knowledge Platform (F&BKP).
profile_positions.title: Project Leader Learning Platforms on Inclusive Business, Land Governance and Food Security

profile_positions.description:
LANDac - the Netherlands Land Academy - is a Dutch platform working on land governance and development. LANDac brings together researchers, policy makers, development practitioners and business professionals in the field of land governance and development. With a focus on new pressures and competing claims on land and natural resources, the LANDac network conducts research, disseminates information, and organizes courses and training. Its guiding question is how to optimize the link between land governance, sustainable development and poverty alleviation.

My main activities and responsibilities as LANDac coordinator included: internal communication, preparation and facilitation of meetings of LANDac partners and executive committee, responsible for annual reports and budgetary planning, external communication (website, social media) and organization and facilitation of events (conferences, workshops), partnership building, proposal writing, capacity building activities (course director of the annual two-week summer course ‘Land Governance for Development’, guest lectures at partner institutes), conducting research and research supervision, contributing to policy debates and publishing.

From 2013 - 2016, LANDac and the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs have organised a series of three international LANDforum meetings: a multi-stakeholder think-tank to discuss new ways to optimise links between land-related investments, food security and inclusive sustainable development. Participants from Brazil, Ethiopia, Indonesia, Mozambique, Uganda and the Netherlands with a professional interest in investments in land and agriculture worked at universities, knowledge centers, CSO's, governments, donor organizations, businesses and investment funds. I was responsible for partnership development, stakeholder engagement, organisation of the annual forum meetings, coordination of follow-up activities, and internal and external communication.
profile_positions.title: Partnership Coordinator LANDac Land Governance for Equitable and Sustainable Development

profile_positions.description: As part of a team of recent graduates and PhDs at the International Development Studies group of Utrecht University, I contributed to a research into Corporate Social Responsibility in the agro-food sector in five African countries. The research was commissioned by MVO Nederland (CSR the Netherlands). Research objectives included a review of the business operations of Dutch and non-Dutch agribusiness, their levels of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) performance, their linkages with local stakeholders and the contributions they make to local development and food security. The team interviewed 90 firms in South Africa, Mozambique, Rwanda, Kenya and Ethiopia. I was responsible for the Kenya case study and contributed to the synthesis report of the research project. The full research report is available via: http://landgovernance.org/proceeding/csr-agro-food-sector.
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant
Consultant Land Governance to DGIS, Ministry of Foreign Affairs

profile_positions.description:
WOTRO Science for Global Development is a research-granting organisation focusing on programming, funding and monitoring research on global issues. WOTRO funds research that is relevant for development and characterized by scientific excellence. I worked as a staff officer at WOTRO assisting a senior policy officer in all aspects of tasks and responsibilities linked to the above strategy.

The Global Health Policy and Health Systems Research (GHPHSR) programme aims at contributing to better health in low-income countries (LICs) by conducting research aimed at strengthening health systems. Furthermore, strengthening research capacity in LICs as well as strengthening collaboration in the Dutch research and knowledge community are aims of the programme. I was involved in the whole process towards the final decision for funding of the second call of the programme. For more information about the GHPHSR programme and the awarded programmes, please see www.nwo.nl/wotro/healthpolicyandsystems.

The Netherlands-African partnership for capacity development and clinical interventions against poverty-related diseases (NACCAP) is a national programme that contributes to the European and Developing Countries Clinical Trials Paternship (EDCTP). NACCAP aims at combining excellent scientific research with sustained investments in the Research & Development capacity in Africa in fighting the diseases of poverty: HIV/AIDS, malaria and tuberculosis. For this programme, I assisted in the organization of a side-event at the 6th EDCTP Forum in Addis Abeba, Ethiopia. Furthermore, I assisted in all activities regarding the programmes of NACCAP. For more information about NACCAP, please visit www.nwo.nl/naccap.
profile_positions.title: Staff Officer

profile_positions.description:
The Permanent Representation of the Kingdom of the Netherlands to the United Nations organizations for Food and Agriculture in Rome consists of a small team that represents the Netherlands at the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO), the International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) and the World Food Programme (WFP). I performed a range of activities within the small team, among which:

Attending meetings of the three Rome-based UN-organizations (FAO, IFAD and WFP) and reporting back to the relevant Ministries in The Hague (the Ministry of Economic Affairs, Agriculture and Innovation (EL&I) and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs).

Accompanying delegations from the Netherlands.

Writing short articles and announcements for external publications of the Ministry of Economic Affairs, Agriculture and Innovation.

Writing a report on Organic Agriculture based on information from FAO and IFAD and interviews with stakeholders within these organizations and in other public and private organizations.
profile_positions.title: Intern

company.name: Centre d'Etude et de Développement Agricole Cambodgien (CEDAC)

profile_positions.company: Centre d'Etude et de Développement Agricole Cambodgien (CEDAC)
profile_positions.description: Conducted a research as part of my MSc. in International Development Studies in the Cambodian Prey Veng province. In close collaboration with and supported by the national NGO CEDAC I interviewed farmers in several remote villages in Kahnchriech district. Three focus group discussions were organized in addition. The research focused on farmers' knowledge about climate change and their adaptation strategies using theories from the Sustainable Livelihood Approach and the University of Bath's wellbeing approach. The final disertation was graded with a 8.4 and is online available through: http://dare.uva.nl/scriptie/384254
profile_positions.title: Student Researcher

profile_positions.description: Preparing and teaching classes in ‘Speaking’, ‘Pronunciation’, and ‘Cross-Cultural Understanding’ at the English Study Program of the Politechnic. My students were second and third year students between the age of 18 and 20. One seminar with a focus on cross-cultural understanding was organized, at which I was one of the speakers.
profile_positions.title: English Teacher
